{"step_by_step_thinking": "The ear lobule is the lower part of the ear that is made up of fibro adipose tissue surrounded by skin. According to Document [15], the greater auricular nerve supplies the cutaneous territory over the parotid gland and lobule of the ear. Document [26] also mentions that the greater auricular nerve supplies parts of the outer ear and the surrounding skin. Document [30] further confirms that the posterior branch of the great auricular nerve supplies parts of the auricle, including the lobule. Therefore, the greater auricular nerve supplies the ear lobule.", "answer_choice": "A"}
